com.redhat.rhn.domain.server.test

Class HostBuilder

  • java.lang.Object
    • com.redhat.rhn.domain.server.test.HostBuilder

  • public class HostBuilder
extends java.lang.Object
    HostBuilder is a class based on the GoF Builder pattern that constructs systems that are virtual hosts. That is, systems with one of the virtualization entitlements.

    • Method Detail

      • build

        public Server build()
        This is the final step in building or compiling a host. The host and its guests (if there are any) will be persisted, flushed, and evicted from the current hibernate session.

        The builder does not maintain a reference to a host once it is built; so, calling build successive times will simply return null. One of the create methods must be called before every invocation of this method.
        Returns:
        The built host whose state will have persisted and synhronized with the database. The host and its guests will have been removed from the hibernate session cache.

      • createVirtHost

        public HostBuilder createVirtHost()
                           throws java.lang.Exception
        Creates a Server with the Virtualization Host entitlement.
        Returns:
        This builder
        Throws:
        java.lang.Exception - if an error occurs

      • createNonVirtHost

        public HostBuilder createNonVirtHost()
                              throws java.lang.Exception
        Creates a server without any of the virtualization entitlements. Note that a non-virt host is useful in those situations in which a guest consumes physical entitlements.
        Returns:
        This builder
        Throws:
        java.lang.Exception - if an error occurs

      • withGuests

        public HostBuilder withGuests(int numberOfGuests)
                       throws java.lang.Exception
        Creates the specified number of guests for the host under construction. Each guest will be registered and therefore have an associated system.
        Parameters:
        numberOfGuests - The number of guests to create
        Returns:
        This builder
        Throws:
        java.lang.Exception - if an error occurs

      • withUnregisteredGuests

        public HostBuilder withUnregisteredGuests(int numberOfGuests)
                                   throws java.lang.Exception
        Creates the specified number of guests for the host under construction. None of the guests will be registered and therefore will not have an associated system.
        Parameters:
        numberOfGuests - The number of guests to create
        Returns:
        This builder
        Throws:
        java.lang.Exception - if an error occurs

      • withGuests

        public HostBuilder withGuests(java.util.Map<User,java.lang.Integer> guests,
                              boolean register)
                       throws java.lang.Exception
        Creates the specified number of guests for the host under construction. Each guest will be registered and therefore have an associated system.
        Parameters:
        guests - a map of users to the number of guests to create owned by that user. This is useful when you want the guests to be in orgs different to what the host .
        Returns:
        This builder
        Throws:
        java.lang.Exception - if an error occurs
